danfulea.math

Class Convertor

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.math.Convertor

  • public class Convertor
extends java.lang.Object
    The Convertor class is used for handling several number conversions.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 14 APR. 2011

      • stringToTimestamp

        public static java.sql.Timestamp stringToTimestamp(java.lang.String value)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a string to SQL Timestamp format.
        Parameters:
        value - the string in format: yyyy-[m]m-[d]d hh:mm:ss[.f...]. The fractional seconds may be omitted. The leading zero for mm and dd may also be omitted.
        Returns:
        the timestamp
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - can throw this exception

      • timestampToString

        public static java.lang.String timestampToString(java.sql.Timestamp ts)
        Converts a Timestamp to string. The timestamp can be created using new Timestamp(long millis) where millis is given by current time: System.currentTimeMillis()
        Parameters:
        ts - the Timestamp
        Returns:
        the String in format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.fffffffff, where ffffffffff indicates nanoseconds.

      • stringToDate

        public static java.sql.Date stringToDate(java.lang.String value)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a string to SQL Date format.
        Parameters:
        value - the string in format: "yyyy-[m]m-[d]d". The leading zero for mm and dd may also be omitted.
        Returns:
        the Date
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - can throw this exception if the date given is not in the JDBC date escape format (yyyy-[m]m-[d]d)

      • dateToString

        public static java.lang.String dateToString(java.sql.Date d)
        Converts a Date to string. The date can be created using new Date(long millis) where millis is given by current time: System.currentTimeMillis()
        Parameters:
        d - the date
        Returns:
        the string in format: yyyy-mm-dd format

      • getMillisFromDateTime

        public static long getMillisFromDateTime(java.lang.String timeFormattedStr)
                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        Gets the time in millis from a string representing the date and time in format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss. This should be compared to System.currentTimeMillis() to calculate time passed. Also it can be used to get millis in order to build a java SQL Timestamp or Date object.
        Parameters:
        timeFormattedStr - the string representing the date to be processed.
        Returns:
        the time in millis since referrence date: January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - can throw this exception

      • stringToBoolean

        public static boolean stringToBoolean(java.lang.String value)
        Converts a string to boolean (true or false)
        Parameters:
        value - the string
        Returns:
        the boolean value of input string as true only if the string is "true" ignoring case. Otherwise returns false.
